com.bazaarvoice
Class SubmissionMediaParams

java.lang.Object
  com.bazaarvoice.BazaarParams
      com.bazaarvoice.SubmissionMediaParams

public class SubmissionMediaParams
extends BazaarParams

Handles the parameters for media submission. Only one media object per submission, please!
Use of this class may be eased with knowledge of the Bazaarvoice API. You might want to use this site as a reference for which parameters to pass using this class.

Created on 7/9/12. Copyright (c) 2012 BazaarVoice. All rights reserved.

Author:
Bazaarvoice Engineering

getContentType

public MediaParamsContentType getContentType()
Get the "Content Type" parameter for the submission.

Returns:
the content type

setContentType

public void setContentType(MediaParamsContentType contentType)
The content type for which this media is being submitted. Review, question, answer or story.

Parameters:
contentType - a content type

getLocale

public java.lang.String getLocale()
Get the "Locale" parameter for the submission.

Returns:
the locale

setLocale

public void setLocale(java.lang.String locale)
Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.

Parameters:
locale - a locale

setPhoto

public void setPhoto(byte[] bytes,
                     java.lang.String filename)
Set a photo as the media object.

Parameters:
bytes - the raw photo data (jpeg, png etc)
filename - the filename of the object. This is important for determining the MIME type. Make sure you use the right extension for the data, ie .jpg .avi etc

setPhoto

public void setPhoto(java.io.File file)
              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                     java.io.IOException
Read a file and set it as the media object.

Parameters:
file - the file to read the data from
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - thrown if the file does not exist
java.io.IOException - thrown if the file cannot be read

setPhoto

public void setPhoto(Bitmap bitmap,
                     java.lang.String filename)
Sets photo directly from a bitmap

Parameters:
bitmap - the bitmap representation of the image to upload
filename - the filename of the photo to upload -- this is necessary to determine mime type

getPhotoUrl

public java.lang.String getPhotoUrl()
Get the "PhotoUrl" parameter for the submission.

Returns:
the photo url

setPhotoUrl

public void setPhotoUrl(java.lang.String photoUrl)
URL of the photo to be uploaded. Use either the photo or photoUrl parameter to define the photo to upload. An error is returned if both parameters are defined. HTTP and HTTPS are the only protocols supported for the photoUrl parameter.

Parameters:
photoUrl - a photo url

setVideo

public void setVideo(byte[] bytes,
                     java.lang.String filename)
Set a video as the media object.

Parameters:
bytes - the raw video data (avi, etc)
filename - the filename of the object. This is important for determining the MIME type. Make sure you use the right extension for the data, ie .jpg .avi etc
